meanings.definition: The quality or state of being pliant or flexible.
meanings.sent1: The pliancies of the rubber band allowed it to stretch easily.
meanings.sent2: I admired the pliancies of the gymnast as she effortlessly performed her routine.
meanings.sent3: The pliancies of the yoga instructor's body made even the most difficult poses look simple.
meanings.sent4: Her mind had the pliancies of a well-trained muscle, adapting to new ideas with ease.
meanings.sent5: The pliancies of the dancer's movements mesmerized the audience.

meanings.definition: The ability to be easily bent or shaped.
meanings.sent1: The pliancies of the clay allowed the sculptor to mold it into intricate shapes.
meanings.sent2: The metal wire demonstrated its pliancies as it twisted into various forms.
meanings.sent3: The pliancies of the balloon animal made it a hit at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her heart showed the pliancies of a delicate flower, easily swayed by emotions.
meanings.sent5: The pliancies of the fabric made it ideal for creating flowing garments.

meanings.definition: The state of being easily influenced or persuaded.
meanings.sent1: His pliancies in matters of fashion made him a trend follower.
meanings.sent2: She recognized the pliancies of her friend's opinions and knew she could easily sway them.
meanings.sent3: The pliancies of the puppy's behavior made training a breeze.
meanings.sent4: The pliancies of public opinion can sometimes lead to unexpected outcomes.
meanings.sent5: The pliancies of the student's mind allowed the teacher to guide their learning effectively.
